intro: Rotheca myricoides, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Rotheca myricoides is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
